other_tests.findings: Heterozygous missense mutations in PROKR2 (c.253C .T; p.R85C) and WDR11 (c.1306A .G; p.I436V) were identified, with the mutations indicating a digenic mechanism.
Low thyroid hormone levels on newborn screening; serum cortisol levels were low, indicating adrenal insufficiency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hydrocortisone replacement was initiated at 6 weeks of life due to these findings.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated a small anterior pituitary, ectopic posterior pituitary, and a thin, interrupted pituitary stalk, consistent with PSIS.
Random growth hormone level was low (0.93 ng/mL) and insulin-like growth factor-1 level was low (27 ng/mL), consistent with GH deficiency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Treatment with recombinant human growth hormone resulted in height increase to the 38th percentile and weight to the 20th percentile after approximately 15 months.
